results.title: Principles for creating clothing
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of sewing and discusses the devices and fabrics used in sewing. Shows how fabric behaves as it moves in light and shadow. Weave and grain are challenges which have sparked designs for centuries.

results.brief_description: Concept of moment of a force; formula for finding its numerical value; principle of moments as applied to all coplanar force systems.

results.title: Princess Margaret: this is your life
results.brief_description: The life story of Princess Margaret up to her engagement in 1960. Uses newsreel footage of her childhood and of great occasions at which she was present; her enjoyment of social life; her decision to marry Group-Captain Townsend; the round of Royal engagements; her tours of the West Indies, East Africa and Mauritius; the first photograph of Her Royal Highness with her fiance.

results.title: Princess Margaret in Mauritius and East Africa
results.brief_description: A record of Her Royal Highness Princess Margaret’s visit to Mauritius, Zanzibar, Tanganyika and Kenya in 1956. Scenes showing the principal ceremonial occasions, the tours of inspection carried out by the Princess, and the enthusiastic welcome accorded her throughout the tour, are included.

results.title: Princess Elizabeth's tour of Canada
results.brief_description: Documentary footage of Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh on their royal tour of Canada and the United States in 1951. Includes glimpses of Montreal, Quebec, Calgary, Niagara Falls, and Washington as well as the Dionne quintuplets and Harry S. Truman.

results.title: Princess Anne: a royal romance
results.brief_description: Made on the occasion of the wedding of H.R.H. Princess Anne and Captain Mark Phillips; this film highlights the early life of the Princess, her childhood, schooling, introduction to royal duties and events leading up to her engagement. The climax of the film is the wedding ceremony in Westminster Abbey; closing with the young couple setting off from Buckingham Palace on their honeymoon. Contains some b&w archival footage.

results.title: Prince Philip in the Gambia
results.brief_description: An account of the visit during the 1956-57 world tour photographed by members of the Royal Naval School of Photography. Highlights include the official welcome, a gathering of chiefs and a crocodile shoot.

results.title: Prince Philip
results.brief_description: A biographical film of H.R.H. The Duke of Edinburgh. A Prince of the Greek Royal House, H.R.H. was virtually adopted by the family of his British uncle, Lord Louis Mountbatten. It was at the Royal Naval College at Dartmouth during a Royal visit that he had an early meeting with Princess Elizabeth. The film includes footage of H.R.H. visitng Paris and Washington, tours of South Africa and Canada and closes dramatically with his declaration of allegiance to the Queen at her Coronation. Narrated by Jack Hawkins and John Arlott.

results.title: Prince of palms
results.creator_credit: A Peter Amavasi and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of Malaya’s third largest industry. The coconut palm is grown as a crop mainly for the extraction of oil from its nut, but it is put to a variety of other uses, ranging from rope-making from its fibre to the carving of ornamental containers from the shell.

results.title: Primeval survivors
results.creator_credit: Greg Stitt, Hugh Macdonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Tuatura is the sole survivor of a reptile species that is now confined to a few off-shore islands in New Zealand. The film is set on tiny Stevens Island, a wildlife sanctuary which is home for 100,000 of these unique reptiles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Stitt, Hugh Macdonald and New Zealand National Film Unit
